page.title: 02FARMING AROUND SHAWBURY
page.content: The next four pages describe typical farms in our area. {CHURCH FARM}in Stanton is an arable and dairy farm of around 300 acres.Sugarbeet is grown for the factory and grass for the cattle and for making into{haylage.} The farmer has lived there nearly all his life, and he hopes his children will carry on after him.He goes to{Crewe}and{Shrewsbury}market.He does not like footpaths on his land because people trample on his crops.He hires{contractors}and uses{artificial {fertilizers.} The farmer said that there is a{Roman {Encampment}called{Rutunium}under one of the fields.The farm is in the{ {village}which is inconvenient because the cows have to walk down the village street.
